author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
The West Bengal government’s move to bring Kashmiri students under the scanner on Tuesday saw a barrage of angry tweets from former chief minister and National Conference (NC) working president Omar Abdullah to Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee.

“Dear @MamataOfficial can you please look in to this police order? Info gathering shouldn’t become harassment,” Mr. Abdullah wrote on Twitter.

In the wake of pro-JNU protests in universities in Kolkata, there were reports that the Union Home Ministry had asked for details of Kashmiri students studying in West Bengal “to avoid JNU-type pro-Afzal Guru protests in the future.”

“Why are these students being singled out? This raises the wider question — why is MHA ordering States to compile dossiers/data of J&K students like this?” Mr. Abdullah asked. Interestingly, the official Twitter handle of the West Bengal Chief Minister assured Mr. Abdullah by tweeting back: “Issue related to MHA. But let me assure u, people of J&K r welcome. We assure them peace of mind to enjoy beautiful Bengal (sic)”.

The NC chief is angry over West Bengal’s move to bring them under the scanner
title: Why single out Kashmiri students, asks Omar
